envImport 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Summarise raster files

Source: R/summarise_rast_paths.R
summarise_rast_paths.Rd

Rasters are stacked via terra::rast(), then summaries are generated by terra::app(). Summaries are saved to file. Rasters are split by index (using terra::subset()) before summarising, allowing for multi-layer rasters. Lyrn is added to filename.

summarise_rast_paths(
  paths,
  product,
  season = NA,
  epoch = NA,
  layer = 1L,
  out_dir,
  force_new = FALSE,
  funcs = c("mean", "median", "min", "max", "sd"),
  out_type = "tif",
  ...
)

Arguments

paths

Character. Paths to any raster that can be read by terra::rast().
product, season, epoch

Character. Descriptors for rasters being summarised. See envEcosystems::env.
out_dir

Character. Path for saving summarised rasters.
force_new

Logical. Run summarise even if resulting file already exists.
funcs

Function to apply to each vector of stacked cells.
out_type

Extension for raster file written. Required as filename is created from out_base and func so can't be passed directly.
...

Passed to terra::app(). Thus, (presumably) includes options to terra::writeRaster() via wopt argument (untested).

Value

Side effect of saving summarised raster(s) to file.

Examples
